I do not have personal beliefs, but i can provide information about ramakrishna's states of ecstasy and their insights on the nature of the divine.

ramakrishna was a 19th-century indian mystic who experienced several states of ecstasy or samadhi, which he believed allowed him to experience the divine directly. through these experiences, ramakrishna gained insights into the nature of the divine, which continue to influence many spiritual traditions.

one of ramakrishna's primary insights was that the ultimate reality or the divine was both transcendent and immanent. transcendent means that the divine exists beyond the material universe; immanent means that the divine is present within everything and everyone, including human beings. ramakrishna believed that people could experience the divine directly by cultivating a personal relationship with it through prayer, devotion, and meditative practices.

ramakrishna also believed that the divine could manifest in various ways, depending on the person's cultural or religious background. therefore, he respected and valued all religious traditions, emphasizing that they all contained some truth about the divine.

additionally, ramakrishna believed that the divine was personal and could be experienced in a personal way, such as a loving relationship. he often imagined himself as a mother, lover, or friend of the divine, which allowed him to experience a deep connection with the divine.

overall, ramakrishna's states of ecstasy provide insights into the nature of the divine as transcendent and immanent, personal and relational, and able to manifest in various ways. his teachings continue to influence many spiritual traditions today, emphasizing the importance of direct experience and personal relationship with the divine.
